posts.title: America restores it’s dignity
posts.content:
I really can’t overstate how meaningful the results of this 2020 election were for me, and I know that I’m not alone here. The Trump Presidency was appalling; the world watched in slack-jawed awe four years ago as the most crass, arrogant, and ignorant person conceivable was elected president. From the outside it must have looked like the behavior of a self-destructive narcissist; from the inside it felt like a betrayal and a gut punch. Electing him once was a hair-brained misstep, electing him a second time would have been an unforgivably deliberate act of willful malice. And for a second there, whoooo boy I really thought we were going to elect him a second time. For a second, I really got scared that my country was not just broken, but beyond fixing.

For as long as I’ve lived, I’ve believed that America was broken but very much worth fixing. And I wasn’t ready to lose that. I wasn’t ready to lose all faith in my beautiful, fucked up country. And thank God I didn’t have to, because my beautiful, fucked up country came through and did the right thing.

That’s all I have to say for now. It’s been a few days but I still cry when I think about it. Tears of deep, deep gratitude.
